definition: to lend money (for interest)/to give credit
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: During the year, 864 applications were received.
sentences.chinese: 年內，放債人註冊處共收到864宗申請。

sentences.english: The lender has a better memory than the borrower.

sentences.chinese: 對放債者來說是收穫的季節。

sentences.english: Other countries' microlenders, too, have had crises.
sentences.chinese: 其它國家的小額放債人也面臨着危機。

sentences.english: He denounced all landlords and money-lenders as evil predators.
sentences.chinese: 放債者都是罪惡的剝削者。

sentences.english: Section 18 sets out the requirements relating to loans made by a money lender.
sentences.chinese: 本條例第18條列出關於放債人作出貸款的規定。

sentences.english: Poor people are increasingly at the mercy of heartless money-lenders.
sentences.chinese: 越來越多窮人受昧良心的放債人擺佈。

sentences.english: I don't advise you go have recourse to the money- lenders.
sentences.chinese: 我勸你不要求助於放債的人。

definition: to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
Huinong district of Shizuishan city 石嘴山市[Shi2 zui3 shan1 shi4], Ningxia
to recover (stolen property)/to pursue and force sb to give back the spoils
